feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 27 at 2:14PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Moderate Snow Monday Night and Blowing Snow Later Tuesday... Two to four inches of snowfall is expected Monday night along the Parks Highway in the Alaska Range. This snowfall could create slick travel conditions. Southerly winds begin to increase Tuesday afternoon and may lead to blowing snow Tuesday afternoon and night. Reduced visibility to less than 1 mile may occur in the

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 27 at 2:09PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...West Coast Elevated Water Levels Through Tuesday... Elevated water levels around 3 feet above the normal high tide line remain expected from the Yukon Delta to Norton Sound with 2 to 3 feet above the normal high tide line along the Bering Strait Coastlines through Tuesday afternoon. These conditions may produce large breaking waves on shorelines and result in minor beach
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bering Strait Coast; Shishmaref; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island; Yukon Delta Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 27 at 4:40PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...INCREASED FIRE DANGER FOR THE NORTH CAROLINA FOOTHILLS AND PIEDMONT TUESDAY... The combination of strong west winds and low humidities Tuesday, along with drying fuels, will lead to an increase in erratic fire behavior in the foothills and piedmont of North Carolina, especially in the afternoon.

entry.summary: ...INCREASED FIRE DANGER IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 27 at 3:50PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Increased fire danger Tuesday... The combination of low relative humidities, gusty winds, and very dry fuels will lead to an increased risk of dangerous fire behavior Tuesday, mainly from mid morning through sunset.
